user.title: Cumraigh Toradh Seirbhíse
user.description:
Cumraigh braiteoir a thaispeánann an freagra ó ghlao seirbhíse Home Assistant.

Roghnaigh agus cumraigh gníomh seirbhíse leis an eagarthóir amhairc thíos.

data_description.name: Ainm cairdiúil don bhraiteoir seo (m.sh. 'Praghsanna Tibber')
data_description.service_action: Roghnaigh an tseirbhís/gníomh le glaoch agus cumraigh a paraiméadair. Úsáid 'Taispeáin YAML' chun YAML a ghreamú nó a chur in eagar go díreach.
data_description.entity_category: Optional: Mark this entity as Configuration or Diagnostic. Leave empty for regular sensor. Data sensors default to Diagnostic (hidden from cloud/voice assistants).

device_selection.title: Gléas tuismitheora (roghnach)
device_selection.description:
Optionally associate this sensor with a device from the selected action's integration.

**This is completely optional.** You can leave this empty to create a standalone sensor. If left empty, a virtual device will be created automatically.

If a device was selected in the action configuration, it will be pre-selected here but you can change or clear it.

data_description.parent_device: Select a device or leave empty. Empty = standalone sensor with auto-generated virtual device.

sensor_type.title: Choose Sensor Type
sensor_type.description: Select the type of sensor to create.

menu_options.data_sensor: Data Sensor - Full response in attributes
menu_options.value_sensor: Value Sensor - Extract specific value as state

data_sensor.title: Data Sensor Selected
data_sensor.description: Creating a Data Sensor that exposes the full response data in attributes. The sensor state will show the call status (ok/error).

value_sensor.title: Value Sensor Selected
value_sensor.description: Creating a Value Sensor that extracts a specific value from the response and uses it as the sensor state.

data_settings.title: Data Sensor Settings
data_settings.description: Configure how response data is exposed in sensor attributes.

data_description.response_data_path: Optional path to extract data from the response (e.g., 'results.0.items'). Leave empty for full response.
data_description.attribute_name: Name of the attribute that will contain the response data. Default is 'data'.

value_settings.title: Value Sensor Settings
value_settings.description:
Configure which value to extract from the response and how to interpret it.

For boolean values, a binary sensor will be created automatically.

data_description.response_data_path: Path to the value in the response (e.g., 'temperature' or 'data.items[0].value'). Required.
data_description.value_type: How to interpret the extracted value: Text, Number, Boolean, or Timestamp.
data_description.unit_of_measurement: Optional unit (e.g., '°C', 'kWh', '€/kWh'). Only for numeric values. Leave empty for auto-detection or no unit.
data_description.device_class: Optional device class (e.g., 'temperature', 'energy', 'monetary'). Leave empty for auto-detection.
data_description.include_response_data: Also include the extracted response data in sensor attributes for context.

value_path.title: Value Sensor Path Configuration
value_path.description: Specify the path to extract the sensor value from the service response.

data_description.response_data_path: Path to extract the sensor value (e.g., 'results.0.temperature'). Required.
data_description.response_data_path_attributes: Optional: Different path for attributes (e.g., 'results.0'). Leave empty to use value path.
data_description.include_response_data: Include the full service response in sensor attributes.
data_description.attribute_name: Name of the attribute that will contain the response data (only used if 'Include Full Response' is enabled). Default is 'data'.

value_configuration.title: Value Sensor Configuration
value_configuration.description: Configure the value type, unit, and device class. Auto-detected from the service response.

data_description.value_type: Type of the sensor value: String, Number, Boolean, or Timestamp.
data_description.unit_of_measurement: Unit of measurement for the value (e.g., '°C', 'kWh'). Leave empty for none.
data_description.device_class: Device class for proper display and history handling (e.g., 'temperature', 'energy'). Leave empty for none.
data_description.icon: Custom icon for this sensor (e.g., 'mdi:thermometer'). Leave empty to use the default 'mdi:api'.

composite_unit.title: Build Custom Composite Unit
composite_unit.description:
Build a custom composite unit by selecting a numerator and denominator (e.g., '€/kWh', 'km/h').

Both dropdowns support freetext input for maximum flexibility.

data_description.unit_numerator: The unit in the numerator position (e.g., '€', 'km', 'ct'). Select from dropdown or enter custom text.
data_description.unit_denominator: The unit in the denominator position (e.g., 'kWh', 'h', 'Wh'). Select from dropdown or enter custom text.

enum_definition.title: Define Enum Values (Optional)
enum_definition.description: For text sensors, you can optionally define a list of possible values (enum). This allows you to assign icons and translations to each value.

data_description.define_enum: Enable this to define possible values for this text sensor.
data_description.enum_values: Enter possible values separated by commas (e.g., 'open,closed,locked'). This field is only used if 'Define Enum Values' is enabled.

enum_icons.title: Enum Icons
enum_icons.description: Assign an icon to each enum value. Icons will change automatically based on the sensor's state.

enum_translation_languages.title: Translation Languages
enum_translation_languages.description: Select which languages you want to translate the enum values into. English is always included and will be configured in the next step.

data_description.enum_translation_languages: Select additional languages for translations. English will be configured first.

enum_translation.title: Enum Translations: {language}
enum_translation.description: Provide translations for each enum value in {language}. These translations will be available in sensor attributes.

update_mode.title: Choose Update Mode
update_mode.description: Select how the service should be called to update the sensor.

menu_options.state_trigger_mode: State Trigger - Update when entity changes

polling_mode.title: Polling Mode Selected
polling_mode.description: The sensor will automatically update at regular intervals.

state_trigger_mode.title: State Trigger Mode Selected
state_trigger_mode.description: The sensor will update when a watched entity changes state.

manual_mode.title: Manual Mode Selected
manual_mode.description: The sensor will only update when manually triggered via the homeassistant.update_entity service.

polling_settings.title: Polling Settings
polling_settings.description: Configure the polling interval for automatic updates.

data_description.scan_interval: How often to call the service in seconds. Minimum 10 seconds.

data_description.response_data_path: Optional path to extract data from the response (e.g., 'results.0.items'). Leave empty for full response.

state_trigger_settings.title: State Trigger Settings
state_trigger_settings.description: Configure which entity state changes should trigger a service call.

data_description.trigger_entity: Entity to watch for state changes.
data_description.trigger_from_state: Only trigger when changing from this state (optional). Leave empty for any previous state.
data_description.trigger_to_state: Only trigger when changing to this state (optional). Leave empty for any new state.

data_description.response_data_path: Optional path to extract data from the response (e.g., 'results.0.items'). Leave empty for full response.

manual_settings.title: Manual Update Settings
manual_settings.description: The sensor will only update when you call the homeassistant.update_entity service.

data_description.response_data_path: Optional path to extract data from the response (e.g., 'results.0.items'). Leave empty for full response.

reconfigure.title: Athchumraigh Toradh Seirbhíse
reconfigure.description:
Nuashonraigh cumraíocht na seirbhíse don bhraiteoir seo.

Chun an iontráil seo a athainmniú, úsáid Socruithe → Gléasanna & Seirbhísí → [iontráil] → roghchlár trí phonc → Athainmnigh.

service_not_found.title: Service {service} not found for {name}
service_not_found.description:
The service `{service}` could not be found. This usually means:

- The integration providing the service is not installed or not loaded
- The service name has changed
- The service was removed

**To fix this:**
1. Check if the integration providing `{service}` is installed and enabled
2. Reconfigure this entry with a different service
3. Delete this entry if the service is no longer available

auth_failed.title: Authentication failed for {name}
auth_failed.description:
Authentication failed when calling service `{service}`: {error}

**To fix this:**
1. Check if the service requires authentication or API keys
2. Reconfigure this entry with updated credentials
3. Check the logs for more details

service_call_failed.title: Service call failed for {name}
service_call_failed.description:
Calling service `{service}` failed persistently: {error}

**To fix this:**
1. Check the service configuration and parameters
2. Verify the service is working correctly (test it manually)
3. Reconfigure this entry with corrected parameters
4. Check the integration logs for more details
